document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Nixon, G. E. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Nixon, G. E. J. (1965) A reclassification of the tribe Microgasterini (Hymenoptera: Braconidae). Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History), Entomology Series, Supplement 2, 1 - 284.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles dryas Nixon, 1965: 85
. Holotype ♀ — Beijing , China [USNM].
Shenefelt, 1972: 495
;
Chen & Song, 2004: 50
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 2.7 mm , fore wing length 2.9 mm . Body black, basal half of hind femur reddish yellow, apical half blackish. Ocelli small, posterior tangent to anterior ocellus hardly touching posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus slightly longer than diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna slightly shorter than body length, penultimate flagellomere about as long as wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum shorter than its diameter. Areola on propodeum strongly defined, closed with strong costulae. Pterostigma 2.6× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.2× longer than pterostigma, vein r slightly longer than vein 2-SR, distinctly angled at junction, vannal lobe beyond its widest part with a series of hairs. T1 nearly parallel-sided, 1.7× longer than hind width, turned-over part dull, strongly rugose-punctate, longitudinal channel distinct; T2 slightly shiny, rough with wrinkles, 3.3× wider than long in the middle; T3 2.3× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath 0.9 of longer than hind tibia.
